title: Ticket #7243: classad function regexpMember should not error if list element undef
description: Classad function regexpMember takes a regexp string and a list of elements. Today it evaluates each element of the list, and if any element does not evaluate to a string, it returns false. We will change this so that if an element evaluates to undefined, regexpMember will continue to evaluate each member, and if the regexp is true, the whole function will return true. If at least one member is undefined, and the rest of the members evaluate to a string which doesn't match the regexp, it will return undefined. If any member evaluates to a type which is neither a string nor undefined, it will return error.
